comment_0: Even though this song annoys the hell out of me, I have to laugh every time he says "Some Beach" cause it sounds like a hillbilly mushing "Son of a bitch" together into a two-syllable word (sumbitch).  And this would fit the nature of the song, as in each verse, somebody does something to piss him off.  Nobody mentioned this, so I thought I would. :-P
comment_1: I think that's what he was trying to accomplish by saying "some beach". It's not just a coincidence
comment_2:
Just what no one 2000 said. When I heard it on the radio, I though that's actually how that verse went.

Regardless, it's still a good song. Something near the top of my playlist when I'm not listening to grunge rock.
comment_3: Okay, so this song is very old, yes. But it was on the radio the other day and I was driving my 88 year old grandmother home and she started singing "Some bitch, some where" and pointed at me. I had to pull over I was laughing so hard.
comment_4:
I sang this song for karaoke once in choir class and everyone laughed thier asses off 
lol
comment_5: this song is hilarious, sometimes you just need to get away to that beach and take a break from all the assholes around you
comment_6: this is a great song..that we can all relate to. and its really easy to play on the guitar!
comment_7: ^ no one, I thought the same thing! I thought it was just me who thought that haha, some people around here actually pronouce it like that. Very funny song =)
